title: Ferguson protests: Michael Brown family calls for calm amid criticism of video release â as it happened | World news | The Guardian
summary: brown family : 'we do not want any violence '
brown lawyer : 'we totally trust ' federal investigation .
ferguson chief : wilson 'a gentle , quiet man '
ferguson chief : 'we have given you everything we have '
brown family : we are 'beyond outraged ' at 'devious ' police .
dorian johnson lawyer : client described stealing cigars .
brown family attorney accuses cops of character assassination .

text: we 're going to wrap up our live blog coverage for the time being .
we will post updates this evening on our home page .
follow the guardian 's rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) and jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) for ongoing reporting from ferguson .

here 's a summary of where things stand : a day of fast-paced developments in ferguson , missouri , ended with attorneys for the family of michael brown , 18 , calling for calm in the streets and praising the work of governor jay nixon and president barack obama .
the family had a harsher appraisal of the local police force , who this morning released the name of the officer who shot brown dead on 9 august .
he is darren wilson , a 6-year veteran .
simultaneous to the release of wilson 's name , ferguson police released an incident report naming brown as a suspect in an alleged store robbery .
the report included surveillance images of a man , apparently brown , standing over a store clerk .
later police released video of the incident .
ferguson police chief thomas jackson said friday afternoon that officer wilson stopped brown because brown was blocking traffic and not in connection with the alleged robbery .
the family said the release of the video and incident report was designed to distract attention from the police killing of brown .
it was a character assassination , a lawyer for the family said .
many protesters expressed anger at the police decision to release the report on the alleged robbery without releasing any report about the killing of brown .
the family said they had faith in an ongoing federal investigation into brown 's killing .
justice is moving now , in the right direction , brown 's mother was quoted by a family attorney as saying .
ferguson police claimed that apart from a use of force report , the department retains no documents pertaining to the killing of brown by one of its officers .
we have given you everything we have now , jackson said .
read the previous summary here .
the guardian 's rory carroll is in ferguson : rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) bandana interlocutor : 'if you were a fireman you 'd be ice . '
but johnson a cop .
so not cool .

in a memorable moment in the brown family news conference , eric davis , a cousin of the victim , got to his knees with his hands up to demonstrate the position he said michael brown had assumed before being shot .
the position is the universal code for i surrender , davis said .

in an interview with msnbc , dorian johnson , who was with brown when he was killed , described brown raising his hands but said brown was in a standing position at the time and then crumbled to the ground .
johnson told msnbc : brown made it past the third car .
then , blam !
the officer took his second shot , striking brown in the back .
at that point , johnson says brown stopped , turned with his hands up and said i do n't have a gun , stop shooting !
by that point , johnson says the officer and brown were face-to-face .
the officer then fired several more shots .
johnson described watching brown go from standing with his hands up to crumbling to the ground and curling into a fetal position .
yamiche alcindor ( @ yamiche ) eric davis , cousin of # michaelbrown , got emotional and got on his knees to de what he thinks happened .
a live stream of the news conference with jay kanzler , an attorney for the owners of ferguson market and liquor , which police suspected michael brown of robbing , is here .
kanzler says the county police issued a warrant today for surveillance video from the store .
rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) st louis county police serving warrant to store for hard drives + video from the robbery says lawyer jay kanzler .
they are members of the community that want nothing more than [ a return ] to peace and calm , he says .
he says the owners did not know michael brown .
he wraps the brief news conference .
next up : the owner of the store where the alleged robbery occurred : jeff bernthal ( @ jeffbernthal ) attorney for store owner says statement coming in 5 minutes .

two more lines from the news conference just ended , regarding police communication with the family and the autopsy : jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) browns were not told the name of the officer who shot their son before it was announced to the press this morning , says attorney daryl parka jessica lussenhop ( @ lussenpop ) attorneys for # mikebrown : 2nd autopsy complete but they have n't seen results
parks concludes the news conference .
this has been very hard for the mother and father , he says .
we hope to see you all at 3 o'clock downtown on sunday .
the family will do their best to make it there .
parks says when brown 's mother saw what the chief had done , she said , why would he do that ?
and so she thought it was very important that everyone here know that she is [ satisfied ] with where the investigation is , and [ she wants ] everyone remain calm .
justice is moving now , in the right direction , parks quotes brown 's mother as saying .
parks says the person in the surveillance video appears to be him brown .

documents.title: brown family : 'we do not want any violence '
text: next a family friend , a cousin named eric davis , speaks .
he gets on his hands and knees , arms up , and narrates what happened to brown : getting down on his hands and knees , his hands in the air , and saying do n't shoot !
that is wrong , and we want the truth to come out .
we 're asking the community to please support us but do not get distracted , we do not want to see any violence in the street .
at 3pm sunday the family will hold a rally downtown , parks says .
fox2now ( @ fox2now ) this is a universal code for , i surrender .
a second lawyer , anthony gray , speaks .
he says brown had his hands in the air and was still shot .
he says brown 's parents have acknowledged that their son had had discipline problems .
he says no matter what further or anything else that may come out , the focus should be on the police killing of brown .
the family feels that that was strategic , they feel that it was aimed at denigrating their son , it was a character assassination , gray says .
he 's now inciting the community all over again .
if you get this kind of negative reaction to this it wo n't be on anybody 's part on this side .
now we 're focused on the side show .
do not take the bait from anybody who is trying to character assassinate mike .
do n't take that

documents.title: brown lawyer : 'we totally trust ' federal investigation
text: daryl parks , a lawyer for the brown family , is speaking at a news conference .
the video has nothing to do with how he was killed on that day , parks says , referring to the convenience store surveillance video .
the feds are conducting a full investigation .
they have talked to the mother , he says .
on behalf of the family , we totally trust the investigation that they are doing , he says .
lastly , we want to thank everyone .
the family particularly wants to thank governor nixon we also want to thank president obama .
this family has belonged to this community for a long time .
they want nothing less than law and order tonight .
as we remember mike brown .
we believe the most important thing , is what happened that particular day , in the middle of the street , is that officer killed mike brown .
let 's not lose sight of that .

you can watch the brown family news conference , expected to begin soon , on nbc news online : jamil smith ( @ jamilsmith ) the family of michael brown , along with @ twitterid , will hold a news conference any minute now .
watch it here :
more media time for ferguson police chief thomas jackson .
( where 's the tv camera ? )
jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) looks like ferguson police chief jackson trying to get on front foot .
is now giving an interview to cnn 's don lemon

local reporters find jackson 's explanation for releasing the surveillance video a need to be responsive to freedom of information requests not plausible : jean buchanan ( @ jabuchanan ) chief jackson : do n't say robbery release today was due to sunshine requests .
those are ignored/postponed all the time in mo .
# ferguson
the brown family will host a news conference scheduled to begin shortly .
benjamin crump , esq .
( @ attorneycrump ) family of # michaelbrown to host press conference with attorneys at 3:30pm cdt/ 4:30pm est

ferguson police chief thomas jackson 's statement friday afternoon that officer darren wilson did not stop michael brown in connection with an alleged robbery minutes early seems clearly to contradict an account of the stop earlier friday by ferguson police chief thomas jackson .
on friday morning , chief jackson said wilson left a sick call after dispatch gave a description of a robbery suspect over the radio .
the seemingly clear implication was that wilson left the sick call expressly to seek the suspect in the alleged robbery .
this recording is from cnn 's broadcast of chief jackson 's news conference friday morning : chief jackson said : at 11.52 , dispatch gave a description of a robbery suspect over the radio .
a different officer arrived at the store where the strongarm robbery occurred .
a further description , more detailed , was given over the radio , and uh , stated the officer was walking toward er the uh , suspect was walking toward quiktrip .
our officer left the sick call , he encoutered , uh uh , encountered the , uh , i 'm sorry .
at 12.01 our officer encountered michael brown on canfield drive .
at 12.04 a second officer arrived on the scene , immediately following the shooting and at 12.05 a supervisor was detached , dispatched to the scene , and subsequent officers arrived .
blocking traffic ' wesley lowery ( @ wesleylowery ) context for those of you not here : street where brown was killed is a residential side street , as opposed to major roadway .

this question persists , despite chief jackson 's explanation that he released the surveillance video due to pressure from numerous freedom of information requests : benjamin landy ( @ ben landy ) ferguson police chief just said officer who shot brown did n't know he was a robbery suspect .
why then release the video if it was unrelated ?
patricia bynes ( @ patricialicious ) by the end of that press conference we are back at walking in the middle of the street and winding up dead .
smh jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) jackson just revealed officer did not know mike brown was a robbery suspect

documents.title: ferguson chief : wilson 'a gentle , quiet man '
text: jackson is asked about darren wilson .
he was a gentle , quiet man , he was a distinguished officer , jackson says .
he was a gentleman , a quiet officer .
he is , has been a good officer .
it 's devastating .
he never intended for this to happen .
jackson is asked : if the alleged robbery had nothing to do with brown being stopped , then why would you release the video of the robbery ?
because you asked for it , jackson says .
jackson again refers to county police for any further information about the killing of brown .
jackson says the officer who stopped brown did not stop him in connection with the alleged robbery .
brown was stopped , jackson says , because he was walking down the middle of the street blocking traffic .
that was it .
jackson says officer darren wilson had served two years with jennings police and four years with ferguson .

documents.title: ferguson chief : 'we have given you everything we have '
text: jackson is asked about the brown family statement of outrage at the piecemeal release of information by the police .
my response to that is my heart goes out to the family we have given you everything we have now , everything we can give you .
jackson says he ca n't release further information the description of the brown killing , he means because it pertains to an ongoing investigation .
there is a use of force report that we have , jackson says .
he says all reports on this will be written by the county police .
as for the incident report in the brown killing , i do n't have it in my possession , jackson says .
everything belongs to the county .
what i did was release the video tape to you because i had to .
i did n't sit on it .
too many people put in foi requests .
the ferguson police chief thomas jackson is holding a news conference .
we 've pretty much given you every bit of information we have now , he says .
he said the surveillance video was released because we did n't have good cause to not release it under foi .
we decided at the same time it would n't be prudent to release that information that could be a little bit , uh , i do n't know [ ] we 've pretty much given you every bit of information we have now .
i do n't think there 's anything else to give out .
video : they killed him for no reason a video has been uploaded to youtube recorded by a bystander in the immediate aftermath of the michael brown killing .
the ten-minute video shows brown 's body lying in the street in a pool of blood .
the area is cordoned off with police tape .
additional police arrive at the scene as residents gather outside the tape .
residents yell at police , accusing them of murder and demanding an ambulance .
ai n't no ambulance , the video narrator says .
he 's gone .
warning : the images and language in the video are graphic .
you can watch it here .

the senate intends to review the program under which the pentagon transfers military gear and weapons to local police departments , guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) reports : the head of the senate armed services committee says he intends to review the defense department 's increasingly controversial transfers of military surplus equipment , weapons and vehicles to local police , a flashpoint issue in the police suppression of protest in ferguson , missouri and elsewhere .
known as the 1033 program , the purpose of the transfers was to ensure police were able to withstand comparatively well-armed drug networks .

along with grant money provided by the department of homeland security in the wake of 9/11 , it has enabled police departments around the country to increasingly kit themselves like military units , even for routine policework .
congress established this program out of real concern that local law enforcement agencies were literally outgunned by drug criminals .
we intended this equipment to keep police officers and their communities safe from heavily armed drug gangs and terrorist incidents .

before the defense authorization bill comes to the senate floor , we will review this program to determine if equipment provided by the defense department is being used as intended , sen. carl levin , a retiring michigan democrat , said on friday .
the ferguson , missouri police department participates in the 1033 program .
spencer continues : on thursday , rear adm. john kirby , the pentagon press secretary , defended the surplus transfers .
this is a useful program that allows for the re-use of military equipment that otherwise would be disposed of that can be used again by law enforcement agencies to serve their citizens .
the program serves a purpose , kirby said .
that said , it is up to law enforcement agencies to speak to how and what they gain through this system , and i 'm not going to inject the pentagon into this discussion .
how this equipment is used to serve local citizens is up for local law enforcement agencies to speak to .
a power to the people voter registration drive in ferguson via the president of the st louis board of aldermen : lewis e. reed ( @ presreed ) also in # ferguson now
the guardian 's rory carroll is in ferguson .
he reports that police are protecting the convenience store where the alleged robbery took place : rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) police just arrived to guard the robbed convenience store .
employees jittery .
'we have nothing to say . '
# ferguson .

captain ron johnson of the missouri highway patrol addresses the media following an announcement that officer darren wilson had been involved in the shooting of teen , michael brown , in ferguson , missouri august 15 , 2014 .

jackson/reuters many people drove down the street honking their horns , raising their arms , and holding signs on w. florissant in ferguson on thursday evening , aug. 14 , 2014 , as some demonstrators stood in the middle of the street .
forbes/ap zenobia taylor , 17 , becomes emotional during a national moment of silence gathering thursday , aug. 14 , 2014 , in seattle .
people in more than 90 cities observed thursday 's national moment of silence .
trujillo/ap
there are reports that ferguson police chief thomas jackson will hold another news conference at about 3pm et .
earlier today st louis mayor francis slay rejected county attorney bob mcculloch 's criticism of the governor for having changed police leadership in ferguson .
mcculloch is heading up the county investigation into the killing of michael brown ( there is also a federal investigation ) .

the st louis post-dispatch reports that county executive charlie dooley , who appeared with the governor at the announcement of the police changeover thursday , now is calling for mcculloch to be replaced : jean buchanan ( @ jabuchanan ) county exec charlie dooley wants bob mcculloch replaced as prosecutor in killing of michael brown .
# ferguson the south st louis paper the call sees old grievances at work : gloria lloyd ( @ glorialloyd ) for those not in # ferguson : long history of animosity between dooley , mcculloch .
this is just the latest in a long series of disagreements .
update : moveon.org has launched a petition campaign to replace mcculloch with a special prosecutor .
the petition has more than 11,000 signatures .
( h/t : @ twitterid )
ferguson police have released video said to de the alleged robbery described in the incident report released earlier today .
update : view video here on the st louis post-dispatch site .
we 'll work on embedding a viewable version below .
update 2 : the below version , via the st louis fox station , works , but there 's an ad :

documents.title: brown family : we are 'beyond outraged ' at 'devious ' police
text: the family of michael brown is beyond outraged at the devious conduct of police who are trying to assassinate the character of their son , according to a statement issued by three attorneys for the family : jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) statement from lawyers for michael brown 's parents on the police report : `` michael brown 's family is beyond ( cont ) the statement reads : michael brown 's family is beyond outraged at the devious way the police chief has chosen to disseminate piecemeal information in a manner intended to assassinate the character of their son , following such a brutal assassination of his person in broad daylight .

there is nothing based on the facts that have been placed before us that can justify the execution style murder of their child by this police officer as he held his hands up , which is the universal sign of surrender .

the prolonged release of the officer 's name and then the subsequent alleged information regarding a robbery is the reason why the family and the local community have such distrust for the local law enforcement agencies .
it is no way transparent to release the still photographs alleged to be michael brown and refuse to release the photographs of the officer that executed him .

the police strategy of attempting to blame the victim will not divert our attention , from being focused on the autopsy , ballistics report and the trajectory of the bullets that caused michael 's death and will demonstrate to the world this brutal execution of an unarmed teenager .
benjamin l crump , esq .
anthony d. gray , esq .
daryl d. parks , esq .

reporter joel currier of the st louis dispatch asks ferguson police whether dorian johnson , named in the incident report released today as a second suspect in the alleged robbery , would be arrested .
they say no : joelcurrier ( @ joelcurrier ) # ferguson police chief says dorian johnson will not be arrested/charged in convenient store robbery .
( 1/2 ) joelcurrier ( @ joelcurrier ) # ferguson chief says dorian johnson `` did n't steal anything or use force . ''

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : ferguson police declined to describe how and why michael brown , 18 , was killed on 9 august , but they did name the officer who shot him , darren wilson , a six-year veteran of the force .
there was no comment on when an incident report in the killing would be released .
reporters were told wilson had left his home days ago .
ferguson police released a separate incident report of an alleged strongarm robbery at a convenience store minutes before brown was killed , naming brown as a suspect .
the report included video stills appearing to show brown standing over a store clerk .
a lawyer for the brown family accused police of character assassination against brown .
residents accused police of using the stills as a smokescreen to hide a greater crime .
missouri governor jay nixon called for a full investigation of the killing of michael brown .
nothing should deter figuring out how and why michael brown was killed , nixon said .
ron johnson , the highway patrol captain in charge of security in ferguson , said police on friday night would reprise the community outreach credited with calming the streets thursday .
you 're going to see a bunch of smiles , a bunch of hugs , a bunch of conversations , johnson said .
jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) `` i would like to have been consulted about that '' johnson on ferguson pd decision to release robbery report at same time as officer 's name

documents.title: dorian johnson lawyer : client described stealing cigars
text: dorian johnson , who police say was a second suspect along with michael brown in the alleged robbery of a convenience store before brown was killed , originally did not mention a robbery in his witness account of brown 's killing to msnbc .
johnson 's lawyer now has said , in an interview with msnbc late friday morning , that johnson told federal law enforcement about taking cigarillos from the store .
we see that there 's tape , that they claim they got a tape that shows there was some sort of strong-armed robbery , said freeman bosley , johnson 's attorney .
we need to see that tape , my client did tell us and told the fbi that they went into the store .
he told fbi that he did take cigarillos , he told that to the doj and the st. louis county police .
read the full piece here .
johnson wraps the news conference : i got ta go .
i 'll see you guys tonight down at the quik trip .

documents.title: brown family attorney accuses cops of character assassination
text: an attorney for michael brown 's family says police are trying to assassinate brown 's character by saying he committed a robbery the day he was killed by officer darren wilson .
ap reports : the attorney , benjamin crump , says brown 's parents are incensed by what he calls the old game of smoke and mirrors .
he says the family was blind-sided by friday 's announcement .
crump says it 's bad enough they assassinated him , and now they 're trying to assassinate his character .

nixon pushes back at criticism voiced thursday night by county attorney bob mcculloch of his decision to switch out county police for state patrol on the ferguson front lines : i think we 're learning a lot , but i do n't want to be critical of anybody i made the decision that i made , to shift and i think it made a big positive difference over the last 18 hours .
nixon says the two investigations , federal and county , are proceeding in parallel : i think there are going to be some bumps along the road to justice .
i think there are going to be some moments of angst .
nixon answers criticism that he was missing in action in the first days of the crisis .
he says he asked for a federal investigation monday and that he has appeared in the community every day thereafter .
it was not until late wednesday , however , that nixon announced he had canceled plans to attend the state fair thursday in favor of appearing in ferguson .
nixon returns to talk of energy , a concept that figured prominently , if somewhat cryptically , in his statements thursday .
he says there 's a great deal of appropriate , active real energy in the community , and the community also needs focused energy .

documents.title: nixon : 'nothing should deter ' brown probe
text: governor nixon takes the lectern again .
he praises an outstanding job by captain johnson .
nothing should deter figuring out how and why michael brown was killed , nixon says .
but there 's a lot of steps between now and when justice is served .
and there will be a lot of other bounces along the way .
and there will be a lot of tension at times .
johnson on racial tensions in missouri : i agree that this is not a black-and-white issue .
because we all have sons and daughters the governor talked about old wounds , and this is an old wound .
it 's time to stop saying this is an old wound and close it for good .
johnson takes a question , inaudible in broadcasts , from a resident who apparently expresses anger with the ferguson police .
johnson replies : in our anger , we have to make sure that we do n't burn down our own house .
vandalize buildings that does not prove a point .
that does not solve issues .
that hurts this community .
johnson says he 'll keep talking to people but ca n't address the alleged store robbery or how brown was killed .
you saw me out there talking .
communicating .
understanding with respect .
and that 's our mission .
i ca n't speak about the incident there .
i was n't there .
as for what to expect for tonight : a bunch of hugs , johnson says : you 're going to see a bunch of smiles , a bunch of hugs , a bunch of conversations so that 's what you 're going to see from me .
johnson is asked whether the of the suspect in the convenience store video is necessarily mike brown .
i have not seen that , says johnson .
but i guarantee you i will look at that .
and that 's why i 'm down here , so i can get that kind of information .
what happened last night is what 's going to happen from here forward .
johnson says there 's no animosity between state and county officers .
no there 's not , he says .
johnson says he has n't seen surveillance video of the alleged convenience store robbery .
he says he 's going to meet with ferguson chief jackson and talk about how it was released - referring to the incident report and , presumably , the lack of a report about brown 's killing .
some of the [ details ] that were unclear , johnson says , i will try to make those clear .

documents.title: johnson : 'last night was a great night '
text: last night was a great night , johnson says .
there was no calls for service .
: no tear gas , no road blocks , no arrests , he says .
we were communicating a lot better we had many leaders and activists out there and that 's what i expect to continue throughout this event .
he says he was joined in the crowd by county police chief jon belmar , the man he replaced in command .
johnson says he was back in the street friday morning and would be tonight .
replogle says the best resource that i could bring to this situation was captain ron johnson .
johnson takes the lectern and is applauded .
if you ca n't hear me i 'll step out into the crowd a little bit , he says .
i 'm here to make sure they hear what i 'm talking about .
he steps away from the lectern , to the protest of media members , who now have a hard time hearing him .
johnson wants to talk to the crowd , not the media .
governor jay nixon is speaking .
he turns quickly to highway patrol colonel ronald replogle , who describes the decision to put captain ron johnson in charge of security .
technical difficulties audio went out .

st louis mayor francis slay said he thought criticism by county attorney bob mcculloch of governor jay nixon 's decision to remove county police from the front lines in ferguson was ill-timed and wrong .

mcculloch , who is in charge of the county investigation into michael brown 's killing ( there is a separate federal investigation ) , had sharp words thursday night for the governor 's decision a decision that turned out to restore peace to ferguson streets .
it 's shameful what he did today , he had no legal authority to do that , mcculloch said thursday evening .
to denigrate the men and women of the county police department is shameful .
for nixon to never talk to the commanders in the field and come in here and take this action is disgraceful , mcculloch said .
i hope i 'm wrong , but i think what nixon did may put a lot of people in danger .
on friday , mayor slay said mcculloch was wrong : mayorslay.com ( @ mayorslay ) for the record .
i believe that the county prosecutor 's remarks were ill-timed and wrong .
# fgs mayorslay.com ( @ mayorslay ) no one knows for sure the right response .
the wrong response was evident .
# fgs st louis mayor slay
you can listen to the upcoming news conference with missouri governor jay nixon , highway patrol captain ron johnson and others on local kmox here .

ferguson residents are angry that police have named michael brown a suspect in a crime and released images said to be of him while releasing scant detail about his killing , according to reports from the scene including from msnbc 's trymaine lee and local ksdk 's ryan dean .
trymaine lee ( @ trymainelee ) people feel the video stills a smokescreen by pd .
ferguson police chief thomas jackson said friday morning that officer darren wilson , who killed brown , has not been charged with a crime .
trymaine lee ( @ trymainelee ) `` i 'm angry , i 'm upset , i 'm frustrated .
how else can you feel ? ''

a usa today correspondent is told that ferguson police officer darren wilson , who shot michael brown dead , left his home days ago : aamer madhani ( @ aamerismad ) arrived in crestwood where officer darren wilson lives .
when i knocked police officer rolled up and told me wilson left days ago # ferguson

people gather in the lot of the quick trip gas station , which was burned during rioting , as ferguson police chief thomas jackson releases the name of the ferguson police officer responsible for the august 9 , shooting death of teenager michael brown on august 15 , 2014 in ferguson , missouri .

olson/getty images captain r. johnson , missouri state highway patrol makes announcement during a protest against the fatal shooting of a black teenager by a police , on august 14 , 2014 in ferguson , missouri .
jines/barcroft media a scribed slogan seen during a protest against the fatal shooting of a black teenager by a police , on august 14 , 2014 in ferguson , missouri .
jines/barcroft media
we 're awaiting a news conference with missouri governor jay nixon and highway patrol captain ron johnson scheduled to begin at noon edt .
cnn has posted a complete pdf set online of the material police handed out to the media friday morning .
the name of the reporting officer is redacted .
much of the material appears earlier in this blog .
of additional interest in the incident report is the reporting officer 's description of his initial contact with the witnesses to the alleged crime .

the report refers to a sole suspect , in contradiction of other sections of the incident report describing two suspects : on 08-09-2014 at approximately 1158 hours , i , [ redacted ] , responded with [ redacted ] , to a stealing that had just occurred .
while en-route , dispatch advised a black male wearing a white shirt .
the suspect reportedly stole a box of cigars .
[ redacted ] arrived on scene prior to i and obtained the following information .
[ redacted ] advised that the suspect , was wearing a white t-shirt , khaki shorts , yellow socks and wearing a red hat .
the suspect was last seen going north on w. florissant towards quik trip .
i arrived to the area and began to canvass .
i canvassed northbound on w. florissand rd .
from ferguson ave .
i observed no subjects , matching the description , on w. florissant from ferguson ave. to northwinds estates dr .
i also canvassed northwinds estates dr. and did not locate the suspect .
[ redacted ] was canvassing the area as well and canvassed quik trip .
the same document includes a note from sunday , 10 august , saying i contacted [ redacted ] and received a copy of their surveillance video on disc of the incident .
i was unable to view the disc as our computer system would not read it .
the disc was entered into evidence .
it 's unclear when the stills , posted earlier in this blog and said to be from surveillance video at the convenience store in question , were extracted .

ferguson police chief thomas jackson leaves the parking lot of a gas station , which was burned during rioting , after he announced the name of the ferguson police officer responsible for the august 9 , shooting death of teenager michael brown on august 15 , 2014 in ferguson , missouri .
olson/getty images

the convenience store that police say was robbed by michael brown and dorian johnson was not the quiktrip that was burned and has served as a central point for protest activity this week , the washington post 's wesley lowery reports .
wesley lowery ( @ wesleylowery ) local tv reporting that gov .
nixon to hold presser in one hour .
meanwhile , march of protesters allegedly making way to quick trip
via correspondents in ferguson including the huffington post : ryan j. reilly ( @ ryanjreilly ) workers at the store where robbery took place are declining to talk .
was redacted , but not tough to figure out .
via local kmov : alissa reitmeier ( @ alissareitmeier ) more activity , cruisers at command in # ferguson .

@ twitterid expected to speak on officer in # mikebrown shooting @ 11 via slate : jamelle bouie ( @ jbouie ) we 're still dealing with two dueling stories , and at least one of thosethe police'shas gone through several revisions .
the man named as a second suspect in the alleged convenience store robbery , dorian johnson , has given his account of how michael brown was killed .
the police have not released their account .
johnson spoke with msnbc 's trymaine lee : the police say the officer shot brown after the teen shoved the officer and tried to wrestle the officer 's gun from him .
but a number of witnesses , including johnson , refute those claims .
johnson 's account does not mention a robbery .
about 20 minutes before the shooting , johnson said he saw brown walking down the street and decided to catch up with him .
the two walked and talked .
that 's when johnson says they saw the police car rolling up to them .
the officer demanded that the two get the fk on the sidewalk , johnson says .
his exact words were get the fk on the sidewalk .
after telling the officer that they were almost at their destination , johnson 's house , the two continued walking .
but as they did , johnson says the officer slammed his brakes and threw his truck in reverse , nearly hitting them .
[ ] they 're not wrestling so much as his arm went from his throat to now clenched on his shirt , johnson explained of the scene between brown and the officer .
it 's like tug of war .
he 's trying to pull him in .
he 's pulling away , that 's when i heard , i 'm gon na shoot you . '
[ ] a second later johnson said he heard the first shot go off , lee reports : the whole time [ the officer ] was holding my friend until the gun went off , johnson noted .
brown and johnson took off running together .
there were three cars lined up along the side of the street .
johnson says he ducked behind the first car , whose two passengers were screaming .
crouching down a bit , he watched brown run past .
keep running , bro ! , he said brown yelled .
then brown yelled it a second time .
those would be the last words johnson 's friend , big mike , would ever say to him .
brown made it past the third car .
then , blam !
the officer took his second shot , striking brown in the back .
at that point , johnson says brown stopped , turned with his hands up and said i do n't have a gun , stop shooting !
read the full msnbc story here .

the washington post 's wesley lowery points out that while police have released information implicating michael brown in a convenience store robbery , they have released no new information apart from the name of the officer involved about the subsequent shooting death of the unarmed 18-year-old .

wesley lowery ( @ wesleylowery ) not handed out : a use of force report , any police report written by officer wilson , any narrative of shooting wesley lowery ( @ wesleylowery ) all we know about shooting from these docs : at 12:01 pm officer wilson encounters brown .
12:04 pm : second officer arrives , brown dead

here 's a note in the ferguson pd incident report on the alleged convenience store robbery tying the robbery to brown 's killing : it is worth mentioning that this incident is related to another incident detailed under ferguson police report # 2014-12391 as well as st louis county police report # 2014-43984 .
in that incident , brown was fatally wounded involving an officer of this department .
i responded to that scene and observed brown .
after viewing brown and reviewing this video , i was able to confirm that brown is the primary suspect in this incident .
a second person , also at that scene , identified himself as being with brown .
that person was later identified as dorian johnson .
after observing johnson and reviewing the video , i confirmed he is the second suspect in this incident .
more to come as we get it .

documents.title: ferguson incident report
text: here is a portion of the ferguson police department incident report from 9 august 2014 , describing a felony robbery second strongarmconvenience store had just come out of the restroom and returned to the counter where she observed brown tell [ redacted ] that he ( brown ) wanted several boxes of cigars .
as [ redacted ] was placing the boxes on the counter , brown grabbed a box of swisher sweet cigars and handed them to johnson who was standing behind brown .
[ redacted ] witnessed [ redacted ] tell brown that he had to pay for those cigars first .
that is when brown reached across the counter and grabbed numerous packs of swisher sweets and turned to the [ sic ] leave the store .
[ redacted ] calls 911 .
meanwhile , [ redacted ] comes out from behind the counter and attempts to stop brown from leaving .
according to [ redacted ] , [ redacted ] was trying to lock the door until brown returned the merchandise to him .
that is when brown grabbed [ redacted ] by the shirt and forcefully pushed him back in to a display rack .
[ redacted ] backed away and brown and johnson exited the store with the cigars .
i then had the opportunity to review a copy of the video surveillance footage which captured the following events .
the date and time stamps correspond to the video footage provided .
the entire incident takes place on saturday , 08/09/2014 between 11.52.58hrs and 11.54.00hrs .
[ report lists cameras at convenience store that caught what it goes on to describe as follows ] : the video reveals brown enter the store followed by johnson .
brown approaches the register with johnson standing behind him .
[ redacted ] can be seen in the background walking from the restroom to behind the counter .
brown hands a box of swisher sweets to johnson .
an apparent struggle or confrontation seems to take place with brown , however it is obscured by a display case on the counter .
meanwhile , johnson sets the box he was handed back on the counter .
brown turns away from the counter with another box of swisher sweet cigars and walks towards the exit door .
[ redacted ] then comes out from behind the counter , with what appears to be a set of keys in his hands .
[ redacted ] then stands between brown and the exit door .
brown , still holding a box [ sic ] swisher sweets in his right hand , grabs [ redacted ] by his shirt with this left hand .
brown aggressively pulls [ redacted ] in close to him and then immediately pushes him back in to a display rack .
johnson continues out the door and out of camera frame .
[ redacted ] , no longer between brown and the door , stops and watches brown as he walks towards the exit door .
brown then abruptly turns back around and advances on [ redacted ] brown towers over [ redacted ] appearing to intimidate him .
brown then turns back around and walks out of camera view .
at the end of the report is a note noting that the robbery report relates to a separate incident report describing the events around brown 's killing .
we 'll post the note shortly .
police in missouri on friday released the name of the officer who shot an unarmed 18-year-old , michael brown , on 9 august .
he is darren wilson , a six-year member of the police force .

the shooting prompted days of protests in ferguson , missouri.jackson also released part of an incident report implicating brown in the robbery of a convenience store directly before the fatal encounter .
jackson said wilson was responding to the robbery call when he confronted brown .
ryan reilly of the huffington post tweeted from a security camera in the store , purporting to de the robbery .
the stills show an assailant that appears to be brown confronting another man in the store .
ryan j. reilly ( @ ryanjreilly ) stills from camera we will have continuing coverage of the developing story .
